Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior glazed black (partly worn); trace of added red band on rim; exterior: black band covering rim and top of shoulder; reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B1
Vallet and Villard Ionian cup type A1 (possibly)
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies this sherd as a Type 10.2.A or Type 10.2.Bg South Ionian cup with everted rim. Type 10 cups were mass produced and include numerous variants. These cups coincide with Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type V (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Vallet and Villard’s Ionian Cup Type B1 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). Numerous Type 10 South Ionian cups have been found at Naukratis, as well as in the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra and at Megara Hyblaea on Sicily, and at Berezan on the Black Sea (Posamentir 2006, 165). The place of production of Type 10 South Ionian cups is determined as probably Miletus based on the results of NAA analysis carried out by Hans Mommsen, Bonn, on another sherd (British Museum 1886,0401.1025) from Naukratis and of same shape, decoration, and fabric.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 53, no. 345)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.164) (Phase 3)
